description: A shell script to start and configure a MongoDB server, including checking if it's running, starting it if necessary, creating users and database, and exporting connection information.

methods.name: mongosh
methods.description: MongoDB shell command-line interface used for database administration and configuration.

methods.name: pgrep
methods.description: Process identifier search utility to check if 'mongod' is running.

methods.name: lsof
methods.description: List open files; used here to determine the port of the running mongod process.

methods.name: pkill
methods.description: Terminate processes by name; used here to stop mongod if running on a different port.

methods.name: sleep
methods.description: Pause script execution; used for waiting periods during server startup.

methods.name: cat
methods.description: Concatenate and display file contents; used to output connection info.
